thread.title: Re: Not budging: Demonstrators protesting ICE sweeps block traffic in downtown Los Angeles
thread.title_full: Re: Not budging: Demonstrators protesting ICE sweeps block traffic in downtown Los Angeles

author: Slam1263
title: Re: Not budging: Demonstrators protesting ICE sweeps block traffic in downtown Los Angeles

organizations.name: coalition for humane immigrant rights of los angeles

text:
Not budging: Demonstrators protesting ICE sweeps block traffic in downtown Los Angeles Posted at 11:21 pm on February 9, 2017 by Brett T. 
Following an ugly showdown between ICE and supporters of an illegal immigrant in Arizona Wednesday night that ended in a deportation , the Coalition for Humane Immigrant Rights of Los Angeles scheduled a vigil for Thursday afternoon. CHIRLA will be holding a vigil in front of the Metropolitan Detention Center at 5 p.m.535 N Alameda st, Los Angeles 90012 
Marcus Yam, a photographer for the Los Angeles Times, was on the scene. #CHIRLA demonstration outside the federal jail seeking information ICE sweeps that were reported today. pic.twitter.com/5MAVYu8QaL 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 Happening now: #photos from the #CHIRLA rally chanting "not one more deportation," outside the federal jail in #dtla today. pic.twitter.com/1jOQzEpU6r 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 Protesters gathering now at L.A. federal detention center after word of immigration arrests. #KCRW #NPR pic.twitter.com/QTlyakwP6x 
— Saul Gonzalez (@SaulKCRW) February 10, 2017 
What comes after an afternoon vigil? A protest, obviously. Demonstrators hit the streets of Los Angeles and proceeded to block traffic. Now. Protesters against reported ICE arrests try to shut down freeway on-ramp in DTLA now. #KCRW #DTLA #NPR #ICE pic.twitter.com/26ZjvKj34l 
— Saul Gonzalez (@SaulKCRW) February 10, 2017 The crowd at the #CHIRLA rally has grown in size and is now spilled into the street near Aliso and Alameda. pic.twitter.com/4eRGK9nYrv 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 This man claiming to be a federal judge is telling protesters to clear the street so that he can go home. Protesters say no. pic.twitter.com/jmamHvGJFT 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 Here is the same gentleman sitting in his car, outside on the onramp to the 101 south bound where protesters are blocking him. pic.twitter.com/bi31eUxBA2 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 Protesters shouting "No ICE in L.A.!" in wake of stories about immigration detentions in region today. #kcrw #dtla pic.twitter.com/LcKZPujkCd 
— Saul Gonzalez (@SaulKCRW) February 10, 2017 #BREAKINGNEWS Demonstrators blocking 101 Fwy. entrance at Los Angeles and Aliso streets in downtown in protest against ICE operations pic.twitter.com/d1P97sel9z 
— ABC7 Eyewitness News (@ABC7) February 10, 2017 Folks from the SEIU-USWW are out to join the #CHIRLA protest in #dtla tonight. They are not budging. pic.twitter.com/7wi1kcDbCv 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 This protest crowd is clearly growing. I eyeball some 200 protesters. 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 LAPD just issued the order for dispersal/move onto sidewalk or protesters will be arrested. 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 The protesters are getting louder and louder, calling for I.C.E. to be shut down. pic.twitter.com/jy3wujifR8 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 They have since moved aside, clearing way for vehicles for the 101 southbound ramp on Los Angeles. Still blocking Aliso street. 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 Someone just shouted, "let's shut the freeway." The rest of the protesters ignored and continued chanting. 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 Why protest? Because fear has no place in Los Angeles. I.C.E conducted raids & detained more than 100 undocumented immigrants today #CHIRLA https://t.co/fdfaGIEWVA 
— Juan Lopez (@juan4prez) February 10, 2017 Trending
